body: can I remove all of them?
Thank you for offering to help, but I do not need help with this.

issue.title: Update code standards to some src/PHPUnit classes
issue.body:
- Use strict types in `src/PHPUnit/ConsolePrinter`, `src/PHPUnit/Constraint`, `src/PHPUnit/FilterTest`, `src/PHPUnit/Util/Log`.
- Add some type hints to `src/PHPUnit`.
- Add 'use function' statements for performance reasons.

body: @sebastianbergmann Why did you deprecate them and is there any replacement for them? I looked for a replacement of [our event loop reset](https://github.com/amphp/phpunit-util/blob/0c82cb48683e21d5bdf2f2c5a82216aa96182f80/src/AsyncTestCase.php#L42-L57), so not every class needs to extend `AsyncTestCase` and was happy to see extensions are a thing, but then realized they're deprecated now.
They will be replaced by the new event system.

issue.title: Provide access to number of test assertions in hooks

labels.name: type/enhancement
labels.description: A new idea that should be implemented

issue.body: I'm beginning to use the test hooks to record test failures etc. but I'd like to include the number of assertions stat. I find it really useful to know this as it can highlight a problematic test quickly, if the count is about a certain threshold for instance. I wouldn't mind if it was added to the $test string after the data set info or if it was a separate parameter sent to the hook's executor. I know the next version of PHPUnit will include an update to the test runner but I'm not sure if getting the number of assertions, for a test, will be possible with that implementation? Thanks!

issue.title: Use PHPUnit hooks for the Statistic tool

repository.name: cakephp-test-suite-light
repository.description: A fast test suite for CakePHP applications

issue.body: With the 4.3 phpunit setup, the statistic tool should now rely on hooks.

issue.title: 5.x: PHPUnit 10

repository.name: cakephp
repository.description: CakePHP: The Rapid Development Framework for PHP - Official Repository

issue.body:
I thought I would get a little further without creating a draft here but there is already so much I have to document so I don't forget something:

## data provider methods need to be static

I got most of that coverd in this PR but this creates a problem in the `EncryptedCookieMiddlewareTest::malformedCookies` where we use `$this->_encrypt('secret data', 'aes');` from the `CookieCryptTrait.php`
Suggestions?

## `->withConsecutive()` was removed
see https://github.com/sebastianbergmann/phpunit/issues/4564 and https://github.com/sebastianbergmann/phpunit/issues/4026#issuecomment-825453794 

The `->withConsecutive()` removal alone creates a massive load of changes because currently we have 57 usages of this method inside our tests.

I didn't look into that any further till now.

## Multiple methods have been removed without any replacement documentation

- `TestCase::getMockClass()`
- `TestCase::expectWarning()`
- `TestCase::expectWarningMessage()`
- `TestCase::expectWarningMessageMatches()`

and even more on the `Assert` class: https://github.com/sebastianbergmann/phpunit/issues/4602

## `Testcase::run` now returns `void`

I only found the commit where it changed but no mention of why this was changed or how it should be replaced with.
https://github.com/sebastianbergmann/phpunit/commit/77e60150c2185da760692277aeb2b337686b1f30#diff-6c939b18f9a1acd49fa0f01507a01ab61c419136f2d0b94e13fa4e13998389a0R19

We use that inside our [TestCaseTest::testSkipIf()](https://github.com/cakephp/cakephp/blob/5.x/tests/TestCase/TestSuite/TestCaseTest.php#L110)

## Removed Hook System

See https://github.com/sebastianbergmann/phpunit/issues/4595

Which we use in our [PHPUnitExtension](https://github.com/cakephp/cakephp/blob/5.x/src/TestSuite/Fixture/PHPUnitExtension.php#L26)

issue.title: Add compatibility with PHPUnit 10.*

repository.name: browser
repository.description: A fluent interface for your Symfony functional tests.

repository.name: bypass-finals
repository.description: Removes `final` and `readonly` keywords from source code on-the-fly and allows mocking of final methods and classes. It can be used together with any test tool such as PHPUnit or Mockery.
